Daly_City.Carville, San Francisco:
Carville, also known Carville-by-the-Sea, was an impromptu neighborhood in what is now the Outer Sunset District of San Francisco, California. It was notable for its reuse of abandoned horsecars (horse-drawn trolleys) and, later, cable cars serving as parts of cottage, houses and public buildings.


== History ==
In the 1850s and 1860s local San Francisco transit companies used horse-drawn railcars on city streets.
